issue.title: Add new param type: json

repository.name: swagger-ui
repository.description: Swagger UI is a collection of HTML, JavaScript, and CSS assets that dynamically generate beautiful documentation from a Swagger-compliant API.

body:
it already works this way.
There is no param type json but the anntotations you provide should in fact work in that way.
Hi @casualjim. Maybe I didn't make it clear enough. I was hoping for a way **without** the wrapper struct.
At this moment I'm inclinded to say that this is an optimization with pretty low ROI. But I'll leave the ticket open, and if more people want it they should put their +1 here.

@casualjim I just came across this and for me this wouldn't be about optimising, but more about having to change your Go code so that it works with the swagger generator, opposed to swagger just working with your original code, right? I mean, would you find a blog article on writing a standard Go handler func that says "make sure that you use a wrapper struct so that swagger generate can handle it"? Not sure if that makes sense...?

cc @schickling

issue.title: Not able to add response schema properties without embedded structs

body:
It was never spelled out in this thread why it is the way it is, so here it goes:

The reason a body struct is wrapped atm is because for swagger a response is headers + body, and so my scanner wants to preserve that behavior.

I wouldn't refuse a PR that addresses this through a `swagger:bodyResponse` annotation instead of `swagger:model` or `swagger:response`

issue.title: Add the ability to use a model as a response.

body: @casualjim  My pr did not address what they were talking about as he Is talking about paramaters not response. I do plan on doing a pr to add `swagger:bodyparamaters` though
